intro: Malvastrum rugelii, commonly known as the rough mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other mallows and cotton plants. Malvastrum rugelii is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
